Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great service but noisy on the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Ktanlim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay at the establishment. The room was beautiul and very relaxing. It was a shame the beds were all queen sized but it was comfy nonetheless. Great location but it is noisy when the club is blaring it's music - go straight to the bathroom and grab the earplugs! The restaurants in the facility are fantastic and we even quite enjoyed getting a drink at the club before going to Sushi e for dinner which was delicious. Would definitely stay again ... maybe not on the weekend though :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, but 1 serious issue”
Reviews.Author: 123WestCoast
Reviews.Content: Just completed a business trip to Sydney with my first stay at Establishment Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, the location was convenient for business, the room amenities (bathroom, TV, A/C) all solid, and access to/from restaurants owned by the group that owns the hotel (Merivale) was excellent. In fact, at one of their premium spots on a difficult to book night, I was given perhaps the best table in the restaurant (and my reservation was booked by the Establishment Hotel staff). There is one minor drawback and one major one. If you travel to Sydney and you're looking for "views" of the Harbour or Opera House, you won't get it here (I was not expecting it). This is an older hotel in an older building and your "view" is more likely to be of the building next door. The one major drawback, and it's a big one, is you have to be prepared for noise. I'm not talking about noise from restaurants or clubs (as mentioned in other reviews) which I did not notice during my stay. I'm talking about noise from outside the building at 3am or 5am of trucks unloading, garbage trucks, trucks with back up beepers, and other general external substantial very early AM noise. I don't know if this is due to the location of the hotel, or the age of the windows in the building simply allowing in a lot of outside noises, or perhaps both. So, if you are a heavy sleeper and can tolerate the noise at all hours of the night, I can wholeheartedly recommend a stay. If you cannot, unfortunately, this is not a good fit for you.

Reviews.Title: “A nice find”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: Establishment Hotel is in the financial district of Sydney. Still within walking distance of many of the "places" to visit in Sydney. The hotel is small with only 31 rooms. They are attached to another building that has a number of restaurant/bar venues. It is definately the place to see and be seen if you are in your 20's or 30's. Us 50 year plus people had fun watching all the action from the side lines. The room was nice, although our carpet had stains and was a little tired. Lots of security so if you are traveling alone this is a good place to be. All the staff we came in contact with were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel but could do with a few tweaks”
Reviews.Author: christopherong
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nites in early January . Hotel was not so busy. Establishment room was spacious and interesting tribal art and craft on display in our room.. Difficult to fit an extra bed in the room with the layout . Wooden floorboards were beautiful but a bit noisy. Overall experience was good and the discovery of the area around the hotel was interesting although it was really in the business part of town and a bit out of the way if you were a traveller .the stay was spoilt by the nite manager who was not very helpful in getting us a taxi very early in the morning. Maybe he had a long nite! His attitude was very haughty and dismissive. Yes we don't like dressing up when we travel for leisure ESP in summer but there is no excuse .

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: markinsuffolk73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a bit of a treat for our first few days in Sydney and certainly weren't disappointed. The location, service and room all exceeded our expectations - the hotel is situated a short walk away from both Darling Harbour & Circular Quay as well as the main shopping areas in the city so we were never far from anything to do, see or places to eat and drink. The hotel staff were excellent also, from front desk to service staff. However where the hotel scores highest for us is with its style and it's massive suite-style rooms. The hotel lobby is very cool and links in to one of the bars and everything looks spot-on! The room that we stayed in was immaculate - probably the biggest room we've ever stayed in with a huge, very comfortable bed. We'd read reviews on here that the rooms suffered from being really noisy due to the proximity of the hotel's asscoiated bars and club but, considering we were staying on a Friday and Saturday night and the fact that I'm a very light sleeper, we found it not to be a problem (they do also provide ear plugs if necessary). The daily supply of fresh cookies to the room is also a nice touch and we left the hotel feeling well rested having had a whirlwind few weeks travelling across Australia. We would thoroughly recommend staying @ Establishment - an exceptional hotel in a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: braidcraft
Reviews.Content: A luxury place to stay right in the centre of Sydney. Exceptional service, modern spacious rooms with iPads, movies and lots of comfort. This small hotel has a nightclub which is good to dance the night away and if you don't like that there is an exceptional restaurant or a cost bar to share a drink. As well this holyel is housed in an historic building. Great for a luxury getaway.

Reviews.Title: “If you want some action while on holiday!”
Reviews.Author: JCO222
Reviews.Content: The Establishment is a place where the young people of the city rub shoulders and drink martinis. The rooms are good size and reasonably priced. A selection of good restaurants within the hotel as well. Some decent sushi. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Cool in looks and service”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel exudes coolness. The suites are the epitome of modern design in Sydney. The bars and restaurants in the complex are terrific. Even the hotel service is a little cool, not much warmth but it seems to suit the somewhat detached feeling of the place. I had originally titled this review "Style over Substance" but subsequently saw it has recently been used by another reviewer. If you do it well enough, style may well suffice and it does here. Those looking for a more pampered style of service may need to look elsewhere. The only uncool aspect for me was the dingy lane the main entrance to the hotel is situated in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: timewriter
Reviews.Content: I agree with a previous reviewer that the place lacks warmth as it was too dark for my likings. Nevertheless, I loved the layout of the rooms and the bed was very comfortable. I wouldâ€™ve slept like a baby if it wasnâ€™t for all the noises. The staff was nice and the location of the hotel was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: WalkerTen
Reviews.Content: Billed as THE place to stay, the establishment was a big disappointment. We received a lukewarm welcome, no one offered to help with our bags or explain the gadgetry in our room. Despite billing itself as a design hotel no one had put any thought into having a plug near a mirror for hair drying. The room was too dark, the lift system to gain access to bars restaurants etc, confusing. It lacked warmth and needs to up its game in and look beyond the superficial. Also greeting guests by getting them to sign a promise not to steal the iPad doesn't set the best tone.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: Carron J
Reviews.Content: A lovely city escape for my birthday at the Establishment Hotel recently. Located in a great spot to access all areas of the city. The room was beautifully furnished with the modern inclusions sitting well against the old building. Dining at Est capped off a well planned break by my husband. Have heard that it can be noisy but as we stayed during the week, we didn't have any of those problems.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplifies the Boutique Experience”
Reviews.Author: TOgirl47
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 17 night stay at the Establishment and wish I could be back there right now :) The rooms are opulent and comfortable at the same time, and the housekeeping and turndown service kept everything spic and span. I thought the bed was particularly comfortable and enjoyed waking up in a sea of pillows. I used the open air shower daily and never had any issues with flooding the bathroom, and also enjoyed the stand alone bath. There were a few times during my stay that I was aware of the noise/music coming from the connected bars/nightclubs as well as from my hallway neighbours, but it was never enough to be a bother - and to be frank, you can find silent hotel rooms anywhere, but the experience at The Establishment is not to be missed. The little perks such as the Bulgari amenities, apple TV, in room Ipad and exceptionally quick and delicious room service just added to my enjoyment. The on site gym is small but very functional - and actually has a large supply of free weights which hotels normally shy away from. If you're looking for a unique experience in a luxurious hotel, I reccommend the Establishment 100%. If you're looking for a run of the mill, carpeted factory hotel - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “just love it”
Reviews.Author: good-times-for-us
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here five times now and we just love this hotel. You feel like you are in your own apartment in New York - we love the Bvulgari beauty products, the apple TV, bath, the proximity, the bar down stairs, decor in the rooms, the Bose music selection. We just want to keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: PollyinCairo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for our honeymoon. Service, accommodation, facilities were all 5+ star. Very impressed and wold stay again. Stephanie on reception and all thetreem were extremely kind and friendly, and also very knowledgable. The breakfast in the Gin Garden was lovely, the decor of the whole place was amazing, and the special dinner we had at est (restaurant) was flawless. Best 3 days I have had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect for a top class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: No parking, closest 2 blocks away, small bed, twin maybe queen, very noisy from hotel bar then bottle collection early am. Not what you would expect for a top class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniela L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for honeymoon. Very trendy and chic. Nice room. Spacious bathroom. Very cool venues affiliated with the hotel (ex: establishment bar, gin garden, ivy, etc) which are uber chic. Being a hotel guest allows you to be VIP at these different restaurants and bars which is a plus considering they're very busy and "happening". Friendly and helpful staff. The only con is size of the bed could be bigger. Otherwise really good experience!

Reviews.Title: “penthouse or pavement - they are both awesome”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently in the Penthouse Suite at this hotel - and yes, it was awesome. A stunning bathroom with a large bath taking centre stage, a spacious lounge room, Bulgari toiletries... I'm not convinced though that the design of the duplex Penthouse makes the most of the space. Too much of the bedroom area is taken up with the staircase and wardrobe access, making the actual bedroom feel a little cramped. Last weekend we returned to the hotel (yes, we really like it!) and stayed in the entry level Establishment Room... and well, we think that it may actually have been better! The configuration is reminiscent of a studio room - the bed is on a raised platform and the bathroom opens onto the bedroom via a retracting screen. The decor is gorgeous and the bars and restaurants in The Establishment are some of the best in Sydney. The Establishment thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating in the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy noisy noisy”
Reviews.Author: Reg R
Reviews.Content: Possibly the noisiest hotels in Sydney. Thumping base, janitors banging and you can hear every word the people above you say, not a hotel for a quiet stay or a sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless, except for the noise.”
Reviews.Author: tinkaminka
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best looking hotels we've ever been to. It was stylish with gorgeous rooms, the beds were extremely comfortable, the bathroom was huge with a tub in the middle and it was in a great location (10 min walk to the Opera house and the harbor). The only downside was the noise we could hear in our room. We could hear pretty clear what was going on in the nearby bars/clubs and also in the hallways. Whenever any door closed nearby it echoed through our room. This made sleeping quite difficult and was extremely annoying. So the 4 stars I gave are based on the great aesthetic design and the very efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best design hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DrFoxNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I was about to title this review 'probably the best design hotel in Sydney' when I thought, well, what hotel in Sydney could be better? Answer: none, in fact. This hotel is more reminiscent of a top hotel in Europe. The styling in impeccable without being in the least self-conscious. The hotel's decor is modern, low key but so of the moment. Partner this with an array of top restaurants in the same building (Est, Sushi-E) and you can happily break all those tired old rules about never dining where you stay...So it is a little noisy on a Friday or Saturday nite: but you want to be where things are happening, no? (And if it's all too much, they supply earplugs, right alongside the Ipad2.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little oasis in busy Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Emm_Martin
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Establishment hotel for our wedding anniversary - great room (establishment dark) altho slightly bigger bed would have been nice, lovely reception staff, tasty breakfast in the Gin Garden... worried it would be noisy at night with the location but it wasn't at all - we'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Frankie M
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel , good situation , rooms are big nice decorated ,very big bathrooms aswell and everything with the last tecnology.

Reviews.Title: “Just falls short of being very good”
Reviews.Author: wisebuddha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times and the rooms are good - very comfortable and nice touches. The staff are friendly enough but there doesn't seem to be enough of them and the service is at best average. The gym is also a bit disappointing. If they could get the service levels up it would a great hotel in the CBD

Reviews.Title: “Central, beautiful design, great bed!”
Reviews.Author: IL0veNature
Reviews.Content: We went here on our first night in Australia. After a long trip! The room was beautiful, very spacious with a nice bed, and lovely bathroom with great shower and all the amenities. Next morning we had breakfast in the beautiful inside garden, which was a bit difficult to find (not obvious behind a big steel door). Scenery was great, breakfast was dull and expensive. Next days we ate outside of the hotel. Apart from that no complaints about this hotel. Service at the desk was incredibly friendly. Due to the location next to the club we expected some noise, but we could not complain. Definitely a high standard hotel with beautiful furniture, great beds and friendly service. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jls2608
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Establishment a lovely boutique hotel. Great service, nice touches like an ipad, bose sound system, bulgari toiletries and homemade cookies in the room. Beautiful bathroom and comfy bed. Great location, 3 blocks from circular quay. Breakfast included artisan breads and great coffee. Stayed in the studio room with the 'dark palette' which had beautiful exposed beams and wooden floors. Perhaps consider the Establishment room which is a little larger if you are staying more than a few nights. Otherwise a great find in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Krystle_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here (Fri and Sat) and I will not stay again. Whilst the hotel and rooms are nice and staff were pleasant, the noise from the nightclub and other disrespectful guests completely ruined our romantic weekend escape. The hotel is located off Bridge Street in a small lane way and the large grey entry door makes it look exclusive and intriguing. We stayed in the Japanese themed room, nicely furnished with wooden floors and I liked the way the bathroom could be opened up into the bedroom. They also provided an iPad2 complete with music and movies. Our first warning sign about the noise was the complementary ear plugs in the bathroom . . . I thought this was odd, but didnâ€™t think much of it until the nightclub kicked off. In its defence, the music was stoped promptly at midnight, but prior to that we could hear every song and every patrons scream. It was like our room was in the club! Hubby and I thought that was the end of it and so we made our way to bed, unfortunately as the club closed, some of the guests returned to their rooms, where the party continued long into the morning (they were still going when we checked out). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless you are a party goer and not planning to sleep. The walls are paper thin, the wooden floor boardâ€™s echo every footstep and stomp and the iPad, whilst it was a nice idea, means that other guests can blare dance tracks to their hearts content until 6am. Appreciate this is not all The Establishmentâ€™s fault, but they need to invest in sound proofing, not disposable ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Wickedweasel
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this wonderful boutique hotel with friends. Service was very professional, rooms bordering on perfect. Ipads in the room, was nice touch. Unforgivable was the hotel manger, who just burst into our room. Not impressed. Apart from that, a great spot to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Jimmety
Reviews.Content: I wish my home was like this...! Luxury boutique hotel with warm, friendly and professional service from all staff across front desk to housekeeping, not to mention the multiple bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Establishment”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights on a recent business trip, and once again had an overall positive experience. Very chic, very comfortable and conveniently located. A special mention for the front desk staff, which was extremely helpful and highly professional. Noise was a bit of an issue but really didn't detract from my stay. Wonderful boutique property.

Reviews.Title: “Sydneys Best Kept Secret !”
Reviews.Author: Sydneylover89
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff are perfect, personal and helpful. The rooms are unique and spacious. Stayed in the loft penthouse and did not want to leave. Perfect location. Basically, perfect !

Reviews.Title: “A trendy boutique hotel, with lots to offer”
Reviews.Author: iain1980
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Establishment. Whilst some might think the term "boutique" just means "small", The Establishment earns what I think is the intended meaning. The room's modern design was sympathetic to the building's history and worked very well. The ipad that came with the room was a surprising and welcomed use of the technology and offered movies which we could watch on the main TV as well as offering news apps such as The Times and BBC. There was also guides to the hotel's bars and restaurants as well as other restaurants around Sydney which are part of the same group. The bed was comfy and the temperature perfect. It might not be great for light sleepers though as due to the wooden floors you can hear footsteps from rooms above. You also hear all the noise of rubbish vans collecting bottles at 5am - I didn't mind it and there are earplugs on offer in the bathroom as an amineity. The hotel staff are friendly, smart and helpful. On the other hand, the staff in the "Hemmesphere" bar are more preoccupied with being cool than delivering decent service! On the downside, the bathroom toiletries were only average, I would have expected something a bit cooler than what was on offer. Also, the shower door leaked - looks like the developer cut some corners in not digging out the shower room to allow for proper drainage. That aside, if you are looking for a truely hip hotel, then I fullly recommend The Establishment. If you're looking for total relaxation and peace and quiet - maybe try somewhere else. My girlfriend and I loved it and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Freshest breakfast in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: loopy123liz
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel. Greeted again by friendly faces on check -in, beautiful automatic lighting on entry to the room. Wonderfully huge bath and comfy bed and the freshest and best cooked breakfast in Sydney. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for young and hip people”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddictSD
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel early due to an early flight and reception held my luggage while I did some exploring of the Sydney. It was raining and the hotel gave me a courtesy umbrella which was nice. The location was great. Darling Harbour, King ST Wharf, Circular Quay and the Rocks were only a few minutes walk. When I arrived back at the hotel, my room was ready with my luggage brought up. The room was perfect! It had modern furnishings and an integrated Bose music system. I'm picky about hotel rooms and I have to say that I was impressed. The concierge had good recommendations on where to dine and have some cocktails. Establishment hotel is part of the Merivale group which has a multitude of restaurants and bars. I recommend having dinner at Gin Garden, cocktail at the Establishment Bar, and then finish the night off at the Ivy bar. Being a hotel guest entitles to VIP entry to the different venues which was a plus as the queues were often around the block. I read other reviews about noise affecting the rooms. I didn't have a problem as I was coming back to the room around 6 am. The hotel is great for young single professionals and hip couples looking for trendy restaurants and top bars to party at.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: The Establishment is a wonderful property, and arguably embodies everything a boutique hotel should be. Sophisticated, cool, extraordinarily comfortable rooms and very well conceived design. Warm, inviting public spaces, great staff and service and smart touches such as an iPad being provided for guest use during your stay. This place is just super cool, elegant and happening all at the same time. Steps from Circular Quay in the CBD yet tucked away on a quiet little alley, it is a gem in this fabulous city. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Far beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: I had heard the Establishment was good but price and availability for a room in this busy Sydney boutique hotel has always led me to the bigger hotels. I arrived through the main bar entrance, a bit lost to be honest as there were no signs to the hotel.. I asked the bartender and he actually walked me the whole way through the complex right up to check-in. Getting checked-in was great, lobby is small and luxurious, girls at check-in were great. On opening my room I was blown away, a large corridor of dark timber flooring led to a small lounge, a desk with free wifi and iPad, along with a Bose surround sound system, good sized bed and a massive mathroom with rainshow, double basin and Bulgari amenities. A nice touch was the giant cookies on the bed, I indulged in one of those before heading up to Sushi-E for a great solo dining experience having a chat with the guy preparing my sushi. All round great experience for a fantastic price. I will be back.. when I get a room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY OVERRATED!!!”
Reviews.Author: thrPRICESareRIGHT
Reviews.Content: When planning our month long honeymoon to Australia, being hotel junkies, we wanted a mix of five-star large hotels mixed with trendy luxury boutique hotels. This one was neither... We actually like the exclusiveness of having to pull into an alleyway to get to the front door. Even the driver said he never can find his way there. At check-in everything seemed okay. When we got to our room, however, it was another story. The room was worn and tired and although we like the whole industrial vibe, it didn't feel like a luxury hotel. The shower leaked heavily onto the bathroom floor and they never brought us extra towels we asked for. During our night's sleep people kept waling in and out of another room and we heard every time the door opened and closed. I think they realize how much they lack in soundproofing because one of the amenities is earplugs. After the first trip up to our room our key stopped working for the elevator and had to get a replacement. The hallways are dark and unkept and the "breakfast" is a joke!!! As far as the "scene" it is AMAZING!!! The bar gets full by 6pm and you are definitely in a hotspot. We ate at "etc." which was excellent and probably one of our top meals in Australia. We wished the service at the hotel was as good as in the restaurant. Above all else the price is ridiculous especially for what you get. We later learned from some locals that this is one of the most expensive hotels and is known to not be worth it. Our suggestion....skip the hotel and have an awesome dinner and drinks in their bars/restaurants!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: LiamX
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel above a noisy busy restaurant / club of the same name. The rooms are not soundproofed at all and if one is unlucky enough to land up in a room above the club [as I was initially sleep is totally out of the question ] . Staff are poorly trained and service is poor. I was woken up at 1 am one bight to know if I had ordered room service. Rooms are nice and have all the amenities one wishes. Breakfast is dismal and takes forever to come .

Reviews.Title: “impossible to be anti-establishment!”
Reviews.Author: Design-Family
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a ten-day family holiday in Sydney. Our nine night stay at the Establishment really set the most wonderful tone for the trip. The most critical component is the staff ... they are young, fun, personable, and enthusiastic. Their 'can-do' attitude permeates everything that they do to make the guests feel as if they are at home ... there are truly 'no worries', and although they are relaxed and casual, they are incredible professional! Both Sarahs, Alex, Danielle, Bob, Brigitte, and of course the master of coffee Cris all made each day so special, and we appreciate all that they did ... more like seeing friends then hotel staff. The hotel itself is incredibly well located - in the heart of Sydney, which is extremely easy to navigate (courteous drivers, helpful citizens, etc.). Just a few moments from Circular Quay and the Opera House; at the foot of shops and downtown restaurants; and easy drive to Surry Hills, Potts Point (walkable actually), Bondi, and Manly (the even provided us with beach towels when we hit the ocean!). The rooms are spacious and sumptuous - and unlike many hotels, everything works - easliy! Wifi is great, as are the huge and spa-like bathrooms. There are touch screen controls on the phone - which may seem complicated, but are so intuitive ... you press an icon, and it does what it's supposed to! Flat screen tv's, ipod docking, speakers, neatly concealed power points. The rooms are in excellent condition, beautifully cleaned and maintained. Turn down is lovely, with homemade cookies left for guests. The vibe is totally a-list and clubby, without being stark or cold - rather, warm and inviting. By the way, we had read some reviews about noise in the hotel, and I emailed the front desk to see if they could allay my concerns. They graciously put us on the top floor at the end of the hotel, ensuring silent nights, which was greatly appreciated! We thought that the hotel was an excellent value - breakfast was lovely in the Gin Garden, and Cris made each morning special. We had the buffet, which was plenty and yummy - from the lattÃ©s to the delicious greek yogurt with honey and toasted granola. A great way to refuel after hitting the gym (small but well lit and with everything one would need to get a great workout). Lastly, my wife and I had dinner at Est on a Saturday evening, while our kids ate at Sushi E (both located in the hotel). The food was stunning, as was the service - we could not have had a more special evening. The staff at Est also had the same friendly but professional and knowledgeable vibe as the hotel. The food was artful, and we enjoyed an incredible and relaxed time. We popped around to the Ivy down the street after dinner, arranged quickly by HervÃ©, the lovely manager of Est. He also walked our kids back to their room after their sushi dinner - how sweet is that? I would not stay anywhere else in Sydney, which has few boutique hotels ... most places are monolithic blocks where guests are just a number. At the Establishment, you feel as if you're a 'part' of something. Thanks to the team for making our family holiday the dream that we hoped it would be! Top notch all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: ilovenyc
Reviews.Content: check in was easy. hotel could be hard to find since you enter through a back alley but our cab driver from airport had no problem. Front desk was helpful, friendly, upbeat. Room, just a regular (only one available) was ok. No views, full bed that was a bit small for the 2 of us. We ate lunch at the restaurant in hotel. it was good and the bar scene at establishment was hopping at night. friday night music was so loud we could hear it in our rooms and it went on till pretty late but I had no problem since I am a good sleeper. In the morning complimentary ear plugs in the bathroom! Breakfast was just ok and expensive so we only ate at the hotel once. Location could not be better for first time trip to sydney. i block from quay where restaurants, sight seeing boats, ferries, and opera house are located. hotel staff was really great and will help with anything so that is a huge plus. just a small little hotel tucked away with a great bar scene. walls are a bit thin so you can hear people coming and going from rooms but really not a problem for us. might try another hotel next time but certainly if you get a good price this location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in Sydney Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trident_7
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, great location. It was a very nicely appointed hotel located very near restaurants, quay and opera house. It has a modern feel not overdone, and the staff was great. A special thanks to Sarah she went above and beyond every day. It is not often you remember staffs name, but she made a good hotel experience a great one. Somethings to consider. It is located off what I would call an alley, with really no street signage. Not a problem for us but if you are used to pulling up to a portico you might find it off putting. We were located next to the gym and we had someone on the treadmill at 7am both mornings, not a major annoyance but we are pretty tolerant, others might not be. All in all a great hotel and we would stay again. John

Reviews.Title: “Hip and fun”
Reviews.Author: SKS1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated old building with entry either through the bar on George St or through a neat alley. I liked the place. If you like W or the Mondrian, you'll really like this place. pros--beautiful old building has been updated into a hotel. Has a happening bar scene attached. Staff was friendly and nice but sometimes seemed a little intimidated, which might come across as aloof to some. I didn't experience the noise problem that others have. Food was good but not stellar, but I didn't visit the sushi bar or fine dining restaurant, just the bar and breakfast area. cons-air conditioning never fully cooled room--set to 72 but only got to 76. It was hot outside and the hallways were cooler than my room. The bathroom light switch didn't work. Made one request to fix it and when I came back--the light was on and when I turned it off it still would not turn back on. Third, although the decor is modern, it's already starting to show some wear and can seem a little cold. Overall I liked the place but would encourage the management to step up their game even more. There is great potential here.

Reviews.Title: “A classy affair - ear plugs included...”
Reviews.Author: Ace66
Reviews.Content: The establishent is without doubt a classy little place. Cool, sleek and sharp, the rooms are kitted out with quality furnishings and all you would expect from a top end hotel. The bar downstairs is one of Sydney's best - my advice would be to go there midweek as at the weekend it became a heaving meat market of sorts. Location-wise the hotel is ideal - within spitting distance of the harbour and rocks - making it a perfect place for a city break. The only downside is the noise. The walls between the rooms appeared to be paper thin and you could hear your neigbours' everymove. We had to ask for a new room as a baby cried throughout the night and may as well have been in our room it was so loud. The hotel provide you with ear plugs so i'm guessing they're well aware of the problem but aren't rushing to resolve it any time soon. Generally, a very good hotel - i'd happily stay there again - but may wait till the aussie dollar isn't at a 25 year high.

Reviews.Title: “Fading glory! Needs to get it's act together”
Reviews.Author: richb0510
Reviews.Content: Uber cool hotel in excellent location. First room was simply filthy. Wine stains and dust and the very cheap designer fittings are falling apart. Sack the cleaners and maintenance staff. Made up for first room by moving us to Penthouse which was fantastic. Also beware the bars close on bank holidays so nothing was open and no warnings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and bar”
Reviews.Author: timbo987
Reviews.Content: The hotel ticks all the boxes clean, comfortable and trendy with good service. The bar was great, full of sydneys up and coming crowd. Great atmosphere highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy boutique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LXChicago
Reviews.Content: First, I have to comment that the hotel entrance for guests is in a hidden corridor that makes you feel like you are a celebrity. Second, the lobby feels very zen and peaceful with the dim lighting and minimalist decor. Third, the hotel is very sleek and contemporary yet warm. The price is pretty par with the Four Seasons, but you don't feel surrounded by tourists. There is no spa, so it's def not a spa type of vacation. The fitness room is small but has the essentials, but it is clean so that makes it better. My husband and I arrived the day after Christmas and we are staying until the 4th. We are enjoying the hotel and the city as transportation is very easy. There are many cabs and the ferries are close by so going to manly is easy. The food prices are a bit high, much to my surprise. The convenient stores don't really take Amex, so be prepared for that. The hotel is walking distance to some great shopping and restaurants. We love going to Paddington, which is about $18 cab from the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice decor, but fail to impress with service”
Reviews.Author: SinDie77
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was great - walking distance to Sydney Harbour and shops on George Street. The interior was very chic too, as it is in a renovated old building. However, the pillows were flat and limp, the bed was a tad small (queen sized, I expected a king size from a hotel of this standard), and the walls were paper thin and we couldnt help but wake up in the middle fo the night to hear the neighbours walking along the corridors at night, doors opening and closing, etc. Service from the front reception was lukewarm at best, only the two night reception girls were helpful with directions. Tried two of the restaurants in the hotel that was supposedly highly acclaimed. Sushi-E was probably good for Australian standards, but we waited 1.5hours for our main course. We started dinner at 9.30pm, and our mains were served to us at 11pm, and the dinner was ruined as we were no longer hungry and we had to watch the kitchen scrub the floors and wash the kitchen whilst we eat. Not the kind of experience I was expecting. Est was better, the food came promptly and the veal was lovely. Overall, I probably will not go to this hotel again, for I would like to have better service and a comfortable stay and I do not think this hotel has more to offer other than a good address and chic decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Except for Weekends”
Reviews.Author: davidlockwood
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 8 nights recently at the Establishment Hotel. The front desk staff was exceptional and went out of their way to provide excellent service. The room was very spacious with great amenities...free internet, large bathroom, tons of storage, flat screen tv, audio system, comfy bed. The hotel is also very conveniently located to the harbor and Circular Quay (5 min. walk). Downside was that one of the most popular nightclubs in Sydney is located in the hotel as well as a popular bar so weekends beginning on Thursday were quite noisy even though we were in a room on the opposite end of the property. While the hotel did have a fitness center it had little equipment and was in a dark interior room.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetPerth
Reviews.Content: Ok so it was cool - for 5 minutes. I suppose some would say that it was unfair to rate this hotel so harsly over essentially one thing - but it was a BIG thing. The music in your room, upon entering, is a nice touch, but unfortunately the next door neighbours either couldn't figure out how to switch theirs off or they wilfully chose not to - and then I realised why the room is provided with ear plugs. Classical music is nice - but not ALL night. At one point (ok, so it was midnight) I rang reception, who helpfully went to the offending room, only to discover the inhabitants had gone out, whereupon the staff member did TURN DOWN the music (ie not off), and while I admit it was softly playing I could still hear it (and my hearing is not what it used to be). Then the inhabitants came back - and turned up the music. After deploying the earplugs I managed to get to sleep at about 2am, only to wake to find the other next door people had turned their amazing stereo system on - to rock. The point, I guess, is, if you are going to leave lovely music on to greet guests all day, make sure the walls are not paper thin so those who haven't left hear it all day - or simply, don't have an amazing stereo system for the hipsters who stay it this hotel to play with.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing bath!”
Reviews.Author: loopy123liz
Reviews.Content: I treated my mum and sister to a nigth in the sister for mum's bday. The boutique hotel was just stunning, from the giant secret passage door on arrival, the perfect lighting and classical music on arrival in to our room, to the comfy beds (and I was on a rollaway!), classic room colours and decor, amazing bath, robes, giant cookies on turn down to the amazingly fresh gourmet bacon and eggs for breakfast with freshly squeezed juice. We will be back for sure and with the shops, city, restaurants and harbour literally at your door step, who wouldn't want to stay!! Thanks Establishment!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's Epicenter for Rich Hipsters.....”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: When arriving at this property was dropped off in an alley and had to be buzzed in to the lobby. It has a very "clubby" feel to the entrance, which I like. The hotel is a small portion of what is a large restaurant and nightlife "complex" full of Sydney's hip, rich set. Service can be hit and miss in such places but it was certainly up to par here. Spacious rooms, large bathrooms and excellent toiletries. I did not encounter any noise from the nightlife venues and the Sushi was outstanding. I would stay here again but for the first time visitor to Sydney would recommend at least part of your visit be at the Park Hyatt where the views are part of the experience. As I have been there and done that, this is now my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamSteveHarris
Reviews.Content: Great design hotel if you like a hip trendy environment with superb restaurants, very conveniently located. Upon arrival (in a backstreet alley, very surprising!) we had a wonderful suite and were upgraded for free. After a day of shopping we had fantastic Japanese dinner in one of the hotel's restaurants. After dinner we also the Tank for a great night of clubbing. Other guests don't suffer because it's splendidly isolated. We really love it!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PortoTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Establishment Hotel in Sydney is the city's most charismatic property, with just over 30 spacious and finely appointed rooms and suites, incredible service, and a most wonderful ambience. It's "modern cosy" in a way that too few properties in the world manage to master conveniently (NYC's Mercer springs to my mind as another fine example of the genre). There are some minor issues concerning noises from the hallways, but with a walk-in shower that big, a bathtub that fabulous, and a lighting that soothing, who on earth would care? It's not very often that you feel that coming back to the hotel is like coming back home. I seriously doubt I will (willingly) stay anywhere else while in Sydney, and I highly recommend this property. Few pieces of advice: - Do book quite ahead, as the hotel is full most of the time. Not that you would notice it. I strongly advise any prospective guest to ask for a "6" room, i.e numbers 26, 36, 46, as they are huge and light flooded. - Upgrade to the superior rooms, totally worth it. - On my second visit (after gladly canceling the Four Seasons) I stayed in room 34, featuring a darker palette in the decor, just that much posher than the lighter design. - Ask whatever to the anyone in the wonderful concierge team and trust them.

Reviews.Title: “A haven”
Reviews.Author: sarahonthemove
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Establishment Hotel for 2 nights - what a treat! The room was beautifully appointed, with everything you would want from a home away from home - including T2 tea and plunger with REAL coffee! BOSE sound system in the room, lighting which you could adjust to about a million different levels, and a waterfall shower and giant bath which was wonderful to disappear into after a day at a conference. It is a bit tricky to find, easy once you get there because of the funky laneway it's in, but also fabulously located in terms of being close to everything in the City, The Rocks, Circular Quay etc. Very friendly and helpful staff, and quite a serene atmosphere when you enter the building. Breakfast was lovely - although bit steep at $25 considering the cost of the room. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel, great service, but expect unconvential ammenities”
Reviews.Author: SFLINN876
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly special. The rooms are spacious and the staff is attentive to your personal needs. Bed is set up on a platform and you have full seating and work area to enjoy. It is not as lush as your typical big luxury hotel (i.e. Park Hyatt) - the bathroom is a bit akward, shower slightly uncomfortable, etc due to the fact that it is in a historic building and was converted to be ULTRA modern. Stay here if you like exclusivity.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in sydney”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in quite a few hotels in Sydney over the years, I would have to say that The Establishment tops the lot - it scores a 'Hot Pink' on the neilsonparc Lust List. The rooms are spacious and with high ceilings, the baths are set in a granite surround - very classy. The highlight of The Establishment though are the bars - lots of them, and all cool. It's almost a bar complex with beds.

Reviews.Title: “Want to get spoilt rotten?”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence_David
Reviews.Content: Just a few days ago, I had my third stay as a guest at Establishment Hotel. After this experience, it reinforced what the hotel is all about. And to sum it up â€“ itâ€™s a luxury boutique hotel that is consistent with standard and service. The reception area provided a calm and peaceful environment, away from the hustle and bustle of the CBD. After being greeted by welcoming and helpful staff that checked me in, I instantly felt at ease and relaxed in my surroundings. My hotel room was immaculate and very stylish. Like the furniture in the reception - the bedding and lounge set was very modern and trendy, but had a gentle feel to it. Furnished touches, such as plants, wall paintings and cushions gave the fancy hotel room - that homey / liveable touch. The room itself is very spacey as I was able to entertain a couple of friends with drinks before a night out. The bathroom was sleek and pristine with an enormous shower, bath, separate toilet area and a double basin - plenty of room for two people to move comfortably. It is stocked with fresh towels, comfy robes and bvalgari bathroom products. The hotel has good amenities - a small gym, but no pool or great views of the city. However, the hotel boasts some of the cities greatest and trendiest bars (Establishment, Tank Stream Bar and Hemmesphere) and eateries (Sushi E and est). These places are only an elevator ride away from the hotel rooms. On this particular visit, my friends and I dined at est., which was amazing. Some warnings though - having stayed previously at the hotel on a weekend, it does get noisy, due to the fact that there is a club underneath you. However, if you like excitement and late night partying - you shouldnâ€™t mind the noise. Overall, I was generally happy with the friendly staff and service and the hotel itself is very luxurious and worth bragging about. Itâ€™s in a great location and you really feel part of the city but still feel relaxed and at ease inside the hotel. The freshly baked cookies you receive at turndown services is something to look forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room, friendly staff, a real quality experience”
Reviews.Author: catkinson123
Reviews.Content: My partner & I have lived in Sydney most of our lives but had never stayed in a city hotel before, so for our anniversary we decided to have a "fancy" night out on the town complete with show, fancy restaurant & hotel, so we checked out the Establishment Hotel on a friend's strong recommendation. The Establishment is in about as central a location as it's possible to get in Sydney CBD - a five-minute walk to both Circular Quay and Town Hall. The entrance took a little finding, tucked away in a backstreet, which we didn't actually mind; it has an air of exclusivity and class. The room itself was beautiful; we were in a corner room, so not sure if all the others are as nice but it was much larger than average, with a huge marble bathroom & Bose stereo system playing soft classical music on arrival. There was absolutely no discernible traffic noise inside the room, even at 11pm on a Saturday, which is pretty impressive for its extremely central location. The company that owns The Establishment also owns a slew of Sydney's clubs, bars & restaurants, like Establishment Bar and Ivy Nightclub. We had our anniversary dinner in their Italian restaurant, Ucello, which overlooks the Ivy rooftop swimming pool. Spectacular food. Not cheap - $300 incl wine for the two of us - but fantastic food (my partner couldn't quite finish hers and she was a little disappointed with herself for leaving any), fantastic service (they knew we had to leave early for our show and they timed it all perfectly) and beautiful surroundings. We also got champagne on arrival included with our hotel booking. The Establishment is possibly a little off the radar - I for one didn't know they had a hotel until a friend told me about it, thought it was just the bar - but I couldn't recommend it more. Really beautiful room in a great location; quiet; classy.

Reviews.Title: “EST.. Don't Miss it!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSunrise
Reviews.Content: Wonderful front staff. Dream Bedding. Excellent Food. (really its the finest) Simply dont miss it!! The Westin is superb but the Establishment just pip's it at the post. Its the personal attention that gets them across the line.

Reviews.Title: “No hotel for anyone over 25yrs old”
Reviews.Author: AirMilesLuvr
Reviews.Content: We thought we were being clever by mixing our last night in Sydney at a hip boutique hotel w our first 4 nights at the luxurious & fantastic Park Hyatt. Boy, did we eat crow! First of all, anyone who can find this property in the first shot, deserves an award. No sign & hidden in some alley, we drove past it 4 times & then had to do "rock, paper, scissors" to decide which on of us poor idiots was going to exit the car & walk into that alley to confirm if they hotel was in fact back there somewhere. Secondly, by virtue of its being located in the heart of downtown & sandwiched between all these buildings, it is dark, noisy & there are zero views. Unless you consider being at eye level w an entire office building whose employees clearly see your every move a "view". The room itself was very spacious, clean, modern & lovely. The bathroom (despite the huge shower window w views of The Office staff directly across the alley) was beautiful & spacious. The hotel is connected to a series of bars & restaurants. We ate at the Sushi restaurant & had drinks at one of the other bars. My advice is to stay elsewhere (the Park Hyatt if it's w/in your budget for sure) & come here for the nightlife. P.S. This insanely narrow alley proved to be quite the problem upon our departure at the crack of dawn the next day. Since you can only enter one way & exit the other, we were unable to leave as a thuggish looking punk left his car parked in front of said exit & smartly left his buddy to watch the car w/o leaving him the keys. We were thisclose to missing our flight bc of this massive delay. The hotel's fault? No. However, the hotel's location is the problem here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: exUru
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at The Establishment Hotel and absolutely loved it. From the moment we stepped into the quiet lane and discovered the huge wooden entrance door to the hotel we knew it would be special. The lobby has distinct mood lighting and a tranquility that immediately provided relief from the Sydney hustle and bustle. The staff were courteous and friendly and check-in took no more than 2 minutes. When we walked in the room jazz music started playing and it immediately set the scene. I thought the room decor was superb, the lighting was serene and I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. In a city with hundreds of hotels, The Establishment has managed to stand out due to it's understated luxury chic appeal and by adding small touches to what is, at the end of the day, just a room. These things create an ambiance and set a mood that are well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is a seriously great place! 1. Location - between the main shopping area and Circular Quay. 2. Service - this place could so easily be pretentious, but it's not, with attentive service and staff who went out of their way to help. 3. Food - we breakfast, lunch and dinner in this complex and it was yummy and good value, even the cookies left on the bed for the turndown service were just right. 4. The room - stylish, large, great sound system with a spot for your ipod, fantastic toiletries, and best of all - a normal hairdryer and not one of those stupid useless things attached to wall!! A can of ironing spray was even in the room - everything has been thought of! The only downside was the noise from the club downstairs - apparently there was a new DJ who was yet to receive the memo re sound levels. It didn't bother us, but it could bother a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A triumph of style over comfort”
Reviews.Author: PollyKate
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. At first glance, the room seemed attractive - if you like that hard edged, modern look. However, it was so difficult to use and be in. First challenge was working out how to turn off the annoying music emanating from the bed head (first call to reception). After that followed trying to find the power point in the bathroom and working out how to use the lights (icons had worn off all the buttons). Tap was ridiculously difficult to use and the basin was far too deep and low. No towel rail. Eventually found the kettle, hidden in a cupboard nowhere near the fridge or the counter where it needed to be plugged in. No side tables near the bed - only a very high bed head behind it which meant you had to stretch up and turn around to put tea, water, glasses etc high up behind you and not at all within reach. Floor had a deep step running across its whole width - I spent the entire time worrying I'd fall down it. Not enough surface space to sit and work. A rug made out of a skinned animal - yuck. Chain on blind broke when I drew it down to block out the view from the windows of the building opposite - only a few feet away. Having given up and gone to bed to read, the ridiculous lamps perched on the high bed head didn't cast enough light to see the pages properly (even when turned up high). When I gave up on that and decided to turn in, I couldn't work out how to extinguish all the lights in the room (second call to reception who explained that I needed to use the touch screen controls on the telephone - why didn't I think of that?). The rest of the night was spent tossing and turning, being woken up every single time another load of empties was crashed into the skip in the alley alongside the hotel. I left the next morning feeling stressed and irritated and will never go there again. Have stayed in far nicer rooms for half the price. Shop around, travellers, this one ain't all it's cracked up to be!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here....... The End”
Reviews.Author: doah2k
Reviews.Content: If you visit Sydney Stay here, great location, rooms, staff, bar restaurants. Dont forget to visit the pony for dinner one night on the rock, recommended by reception, who made our reservations for us. Our biggest mistake was not staying here for our whole visit as we thought it would be too expensive, but they do good midweek deals we didnt realise. Dont even look at vibe hotel however good the pool looks and cheap rates!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: cisis77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect! So trendy and in a beatiful position in the centre of Sydney. The rooms and large and very very nice and clean. The bar and restaurant are fantasticly designed and always full of nice people. Stay in this hotel while your are in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: loveluxury1
Reviews.Content: Booked here because we thought it looked pretty trendy and seeing as we enjoy good bars, clubs and restaurants we thought it would be ideal. How wrong we were... stayed one night and moved to the Shangri La. Pretentious is the name here. Rumours from some people we met in Australia indicated this place, including the vile Ivy Complex are going bust... fingers crossed!

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, great location and fun bar atmospheres”
Reviews.Author: hoosnelson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the edge of the business district and the rocks area, so it made walking to all the major sites very convenient. A perk of staying here is free access to the bars and nightclubs that are also owned by this company, some with pretty long lines and high cover charges on the weekends. Very trendy boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small design hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarudeone
Reviews.Content: small design hotel, very nice interior design, free w-lan internet access

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bambel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Establishment Hotel in room 38 after a work function. The hotel's main entrance can be reached via a small and smelly lane so we decided to get to our room through the Establishment Pub. Not a good idea and very unpleasant experience as quite a few people appeared very intoxicated and aggressive. I later found out that the pub is rated a Level 2 premise by the NSW Government (which means restrictions apply aimed at reducing alcohol-related violence and anti-social behaviuour and that 12-18 assaults take place on or around the premises each year). Once in our room the disappointment was huge. Yes, they are trying hard to make it look hip and the room does look cool if you don't look to close but the furniture and the finishes in general have a cheap feel to them. Our room had a shabby view and was very dark. Yes, I know, that's the way a lot of so called boutique hotels in NYC look like but i still prefer a truly stylish, bright hotel room with quality finishes. The shower was leaking and the position of the tap in the shower (opposite wall) was very inconvenient. The worst of all, however, was a loud noise during the whole night presumably coming from a pipe or similar. My wife and I are not light sleepers but we hardly got any sleep that night because of the very intense and annoying noise. A hotel which doesn't provide for a good night's sleep is not worth the money. Sorry, the Establishment is not living up to the hype and I can only recommend to avoid it if you want to sleep well in a pleasant and safe environment

Reviews.Title: “A cool hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RobertsonTaylor
Reviews.Content: We researched multiple hotels and settled on the Establishment after reading reviews on TripAdvisor, and I'm so glad we did! The hotel was perfect for our stay in Sydney. Between the location and the in-house bars, we weren't far from a fun night out and we were on our honeymoon, so we went out every night. The noise was minimal and our room was cleaned without incident. And as an American, I loved the fresh baked chocolate chip cookies left in our room each day!

Reviews.Title: “a very hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: quitter
Reviews.Content: the hotel room is great, very spacious. however, i could still hear the music from the bars even with all the windows shut! lucky it was not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JonesTheBartender
Reviews.Content: Travelling back and forth to Sydney every weekend I experience different hotels all the time. This place is very comfortable, but you could go to another hotel and have a similar experience with 1/3 of the cost. Hotel staff were pleasant, food was nice, but when you pay this much it should be. Stayed over the weekend, went to the bar downstairs and a doorman with short man syndrome said i couldnt get in because i wasnt on this fake guest list. When I told him i was paying $1200 for one of the rooms he let me in. Very unprofessional. You only remember the bad experiences and although the quality of the hotel is nice, the same cant be said for some of their staff.

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel, very glad i chose it”
Reviews.Author: snowsfieldsUK
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Sydney for business from the UK I had been booked into the Kirketon for business but read some poor reviews about it being shabby so decided to take a punt on Establisment based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and also Tablet Hotels. Absoultely brilliant hotel, rooms are so large they would be classed as penthouses in UK or US cities, like new also. Very contempary design but still felt very comfortable, similar feel to Viceroy in Santa Monica. Very happy I chose this place would recommend 110%.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: medellino1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend as I had a function to attend. Initial check in staff were rather rude. However, I was tired and checked into my room. I asked for a smoking but this was not available even though I booked a month in advance. I was told to wait till the next day and I will be moved. Got to my room which was nice. Very modern feel, very cool. The cookie was delicious and the bathroom I could live in. Slept very well coudn't hear any noise. Woke up the next day and went down to check on my smoking room (Bad habit I know) and moved. The next room was bigger, but the floor creaked everytime I made a step. Was high irritating. I made booking for Sushi E for me and 2 friends. No problem there. However, on our way there we were stopped by the 'doorman' and as I was not all dressed up ( still presentable and duh I was sleeping there) I was basically accused of not having a booking. Horrible! Restaurant though was a great experience. That night sleeping though was terrible. The nightclub was below and all I could hear was drunken louts swearing and breaking bottles. Check out was quick and the 1 staff present at that time were very professional. I wish they were there when I checked in. Doubt after the hit and miss state of this place I think next time I will book a suite at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: David_Perth_WA
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveler I have a lot of short stays in CBD hotels. Big hotels are much of a muchness so i try to pick smaller different hotels. The Establishment is very different. Its actually on a laneway off Geroge Street behind the well known bar/restuarant facing the street. The solid front door opens into a huge lobby with a mixture of modern style in a grand old building. Exceptional friendly staff that make this place - they are and sincere rather without that plastic smile often found in big hotels. The 40 rooms are nearly all different due to the fact that the property is an old warehouse conversion. I had room 31 - it is ultra cool with sensational bathroom with full size tub massive shower recess and separate toilet. For a couple looking for a peaceful CBD getaway or a tired business traveler this place is good and its surrounded by excellent bars and restuarants. Critcisms minor only.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool boutique hotel - tons of character, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyts
Reviews.Content: We had a fab stay in Establishment - I'd echo the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. Very cool decor/atmosphere, handy location, we found the service high quality. Definitely worth checking out the attached bars and restaurants, we especially loved Sushi E and Hemmesphere. Only real negative that room could be quite dark (limited natural light). Will definitely stay here next time in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarleyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: What a spot!! Great spacious rooms, fantastic staff and an exciting location. All the restaurants and bars you could ask for at your front door and only a hop, skip and a jump from circular quay. No better boutique hotel in Sydney and a real friendly vibe. You'll love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Nice boutique hotel with good rates”
Reviews.Author: swixo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has fewer rooms, but they are nice and big. The furnishings were nice and the decor contemporary. I like the boutique feel and you get it here. The service was excellent and restaurants surprisingly good. The sushi restaurant is especially good. The location of this hotel may be off-putting at first - it is in an alley way - but this problem will fade quickly. You are two blocks from the harbor and opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomas1973
Reviews.Content: Stylish, elegant, big and functional rooms! For once, a hotel room where there's actually plenty of room! And there's also a large bathroom, where the wall to the bathtub can open up into the main room, and seperate rooms for the shower and WC. Flat screen and a stereo (bring your iPod, or borrow CD's at the reception), and a well stacked bar. Plush and comfortable bed. The rooms are the best part of this hotel, but the rest's not bad either. Hidden down a small anonymous alley, you'll find the big, but discreetly marked door that's the entrance to the Establishment. A small lobby with professional service with the pleasant and causual aussie temper to it. The hotel's connected to a large bar/restaurant building where the it seems the nearby young financial crowd hangs, and up the through the floors are several restaurants and a club, all very attractive and good. The sushi bar is excellent, and the lounge bar perfect for a drink. Everything is stylish and boutique-like, without feeling over the top. The hotel is in the financial district, but very close to the harbour and opera house, as well as close to the center. A 5 min walk in either direction and you're there. We had a fantastic stay here. You'll really want to just savour the room. Highly recommended if you're looking for a stylish stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney with style.”
Reviews.Author: k0sh
Reviews.Content: There's something about Sydney nouveau-riche snobbery that annoys me on every visit. But the Establishment Hotel soothed my agitation away. If the taxi drivers of Sydney are any barometer, the boutique Establishment Hotel is little known. Fortunately they can all find the nearby hotel bar, behind which this surprisingly charming little inn is tucked away. How do you appreciate a hotel? What's the can't-do-without essential element? The decor, the service, the location, the facilities? The Establishment is not a place for the business traveller, nor for families; this is most decidedly a hiding place for the discreet, be they couples or A-listers. The warehouse conversion has been most elegantly performed, making good use of old oak beams, understated colour and concealed lighting to produce rooms of surpassing ambience. The staff take their jobs seriously but not themselves; they actually seem to enjoy the work. The service is responsive, friendly, quick and generous. Nothing we asked for was a problem, everything about the room and communal areas was flawlessly executed, and you're never asked to sign for anything. It's not very Sydney. Way too classy. They should've built this in Melbourne. Highly deserving of their 2006 "Best Boutique Hotel" award.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Personified”
Reviews.Author: MNLMumbai
Reviews.Content: A luxury boutique hotel very conveniently placed for professionals and for shopping! Rooms are magnificent, you walk in and feel pampered! The views are nothing to talk about but you don't look beyond the room once inside. Service is very good and the staff very helpful. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meath_09
Reviews.Content: Stunning Hotel in a Stunning City. Very Modern with excellent interior design. Hopefully we'll get back to Sydney soon and we will be returning. Recommend this hotel for a lavish top quality stay, you will enjoy your stay as we did

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan111
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Very modern style that is neat for a vacation stay. This is a place for 20-30 year olds who like the modern style. Very neat studio type room. Large bath and neat showers too. Try it out a night or two. It is expensive ($200+ a night).

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm but hope the builders have stopped!!”
Reviews.Author: Raf1966
Reviews.Content: Once again I had the pleasure of 3 nights at the Establishment. As usual the check in was smooth and I was in a gorgeous airy room within a few minutes. Tried the new bars down at the Ivy but it was Sunday night and not much was open so ended up at Pony Restaurant in the Rocks which is very worth a visit. I love breakfast in the "Garden". The continental buffet is simple and nutritious and a great way to start the day. Nothing much else to say except it's a wonderful place to stay. BUT.....next door the is some building work going on and for some reason the builders were starting at some god awful hour....could have been 5.30am!! drilling for all they were worth. I was on NZ time so was sort of awake but still it didn't help with the morning lie in. I mentioned this to a staff member who said it had been an ongoing problem which they were trying to deal with, so far unsuccessfully, at the highest level. Hopefully that is no longer a problem but at least gives me something to write about in the negative. I actually sent in an email to the hotel to mention this and have received nothing back which is unusual. I suggested they could have provided ear plugs to the guests :-) Still it was another lovely visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnnajames
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney after 24 hours of travelling, got to the hotel at 10am and it was so calming, quiet and peaceful, we weren't expecting the room to be ready but were so relieved when it was. Room was on high floor and one of the pale ones, it was really large with great bathroom, service was excellent, really friendly helpful girls, top tip - go to the Japanese bar/restaurant there, it is amazing. Would def sty there again when go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trinitymcq
Reviews.Content: Although this was one year ago I felt I had to post this review as this hotel was one of our best experiences on our tour of the east coast of Australia. Very stylish but warm, lovely extras such as tea/coffee maker in the room and enormous cookies that are replenished every day. Staff are very nice and helpful. We had dinner at Est. Restaurant which is beautiful, has a very "Zen-like" feeling about it, food is delicious, excellent wine list and very knowledgeable, pleasant staff. Hotel location is brilliant, too, as in walking distance to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bauertime
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which makes you feel a million $$$$. It was a little hard to find as the lane to enter the hotel does not feature on the main city maps but once you get there, you kind of like it that way. Reception were very welcoming and efficent. Our room (an establishment room) was a very well thought out space combining bedroom and bathroom with a shutter door between. it looks better than it sounds. The views werent amazing but what can you expect from a city centre hotel. While at the hotel we ate ate their sushi bar, which was very trending and The Pony Restaurant in the Rocks. Both very good.

Reviews.Title: “Want to be a rock star...STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Marc_on_TV
Reviews.Content: OK, so here is the cool thing...if you stay at the hotel you get to walk through the bar and the restaurant which are hard to get into then walk past the serving area into a special elevator and whisked up to your ultra modern room with massive shower and huge tub. This place took care of us, a little hard to find the front door at first, but once we got there we slept like fat and happy babies. The sushi restaurant wasn't the greatest, but the care from the hotel was worth it. They treat you like a celeb, seriously...as a hotel guest you are the A list. Well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “So cool!”
Reviews.Author: Snorrido
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights in sept 2007. The stay was perfect, location was good and everything about the hotel was so cool. So if youÂ´re aiming for a hip stay in Sydney the Est is it.

Reviews.Title: “A fun place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Establishment Hotel overnight as a special treat as we were dining at Est. which is located on level one. The restaurant was wonderful and the food truly scrumptious especially my entrÃ©e the Moreton bay bug with snow peas, lime and coriander cress and not to mention the mouth watering passionfruit soufflÃ©. I know now why Est. has a 3 chef hat rating , as itâ€™s a real fine dining experience and I highly recommend dining here if you are a guest at the Establishment Hotel. Check â€“ in. Fast , efficient and extremely friendly staff. Room â€“ Our room was spacious with wide timber floor boards and overhanging wooden beams which created a rustic chic dÃ©cor. There was a comfortable sofa and coffee table, CD player, mini bar, plasma TV, and internet connection. However, although the room was super trendy and modern it lacked two important ingredients, natural light and privacy. If you opened up the curtains you looked directly into an office building where people worked. The worst aspect of this was in the gorgeous bathroom which was spoilt by a purple curtain across the whole window ..if you opened it , well the office workers would see you in your full glory ! In the morning the room was incredibly dark and lights had to be turned on. Bathroom â€“ The bathroom was divine with a large modern bath tub, walk-in shower and a two basin vanity unit. Dressing robes were also supplied. The Establishment Hotel is a fun place to stay and if wanting a intimate hotel for a special occasion then this hotel fits the bill. Basically, the Establishment has 3 restaurants the Garden Room where breakfast is served , Est. one of Sydneyâ€™s top restaurants and Sushi E which is Japanese; so one does not need to venture outside as the hotel also houses 3 super funky bars. The Hemmesphere Bar is located on the 4th floor and is super trendy serving cool cocktails plus there are 2 other bars on the ground floor, and next door is Tanks which is Sydney top nightclub. I have given the Establishment Hotel a 5 star rating primary for itâ€™s overall ambience and groovy bars and scrumptious restaurants. The room â€¦.questionable for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Indescribable”
Reviews.Author: Daxidel
Reviews.Content: The Establishment is even harder to explain than Blue. It is understated and eye-catching at the same time. The jagged bottom of the building is scorched brick up to about 7 feet, and the top is modern glass and metal. It is decorated minimally in light neutral colors. There is incense burning in the lobby. There is an abstract-artsy type metal waterfall in their breakfast room. My room was understated (in a tasteful way) but high-tech. The telephone doubled as some kind of room control computer. I know this because the porter checked my room temperature and turned on the (highly efficient) vacuum fan by pressing a button on the telephone. Every light in the room was on a dimmer-switch that could be controlled by switches by the door and probably by telephone. Also if I got up in the middle of the night, I could touch the telephone and it would light up so I could find the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and there was a huge flat screen TV. Service was outstanding. At my single request at the front desk, they brought up cappuccino and oranges within 5 minutes after my wakeup call, whenever that was. They escorted me to my room whenever I went up, although this may be because my elevator card wasnâ€™t working right. The receptionist called to determine if I needed help getting to dinner on time and came up to my room to help me put on a necklace. And most people in Sydney already know this: They leave big delicious chocolate and chocolate-chip cookies on your bed every day. I had been told by Fodorites that there was no view from rooms in the Establishment, but when I entered my room the first time, I asked the porter to open the shades anyway, expecting to see brick walls. I did not see brick walls. What I saw was amazing: the well-lit fifth floor of a full office in busy mode. You see, outside the Establishment building there is a narrow alleyway, and then the next building, which was almost all glass. There were very busy offices in this glass building. I was told they were offices of a bank. The many personnel there paid me no attention although they had to see me, unless they were in a different dimension. I had brought binoculars, and considered using them to read their computer screens and whatever memos they were frantically running around with, but I was afraid I might be arrested. Highlight: Est restaurant Est, a restaurant in the Establishment, is locally famous in Sydney, and is frequented mostly for important anniversaries and birthdays. I opted for a fixed five course meal. I had wonton soup â€“ (they didnâ€™t call it this), pateâ€™, the mini Australian lobster they call a bug, a lamb chop served with veggies, and a large cheese platter with quince paste and of course that plate of homemade mini candies and cookies that such restaurants like to bring, just in case you are not completely full. As expected, the food was excellent and nothing unusual happened.

Reviews.Title: “When Can I Move In????”
Reviews.Author: Opalnera
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here 2 nights for my birthday (a Saturday and Sunday night). Next time I would definitely book in on a Friday and Saturday night as not much is open on a Sunday night in Sydney. The rooms are fantastic. We stayed in an Establishment Room. They have a huge bathroom and the shower was amazing. The bed is really comfy and they even have a little sitting area with a coffee table, a chaise and couple of arm chairs. Room service is good and reasonably priced (although there was a minor stuff up they sent our room service to the wrong room and I had to telephone and find out what happened to it but they fixed it up no problems and didn't charge us for it). I will say the staff are quite young, but very enthusiastic. The only thing I would suggest to the hotel is to update some of their technology, the TVs are pretty dated (cmon guys, flat screens please) and you have to connect to the internet with a cable (no wireless) but at least the internet is complimentary. They were very helpful with printing out or boarding passes for the plane and nothing really was too much trouble. We didn't eat at the Est. restaurant but we wish we had (and next time definitely will). In fact next time we will book in and not leave the hotel at all, it has everything you need. They really make you feel like a celebrity as you are placed on the list for the club and bars attached to the hotel (especially at Tank where it gets a very long line of people wanting to get in although this is probably one for the under 25s). Hemmesphere was a fantastic bar, very comfortable, classy and has full wait service and even easier you can charge it to your room.
