For cheaper food, you can't go past the Garden Bar, which is great food at pub grub prices. The location is great, about halfway between the Pitt Street mall and Circular Quay. Cab drivers did have a bit of an issue finding the place, as it is down an alley with a sneaky door into the hotel itself. Insist the drop you right in front as the street is a bit grotty.

Reviews.Title: “Great bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: LabelleLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Establishment in March 2008 for 1 night. It was our second visit, our first being in February 2005. On both occasions, we absolutely loved the hotel. Special mention must be made to the bathrooms, they are huge and very luxurious with a lovely bath in the middle of the room and an enormous shower at one end with the largest shower head I've ever seen. The bedrooms are spacious with a great sound system and flat screen TV and the beds are incredibly comfortable. We found the front desk staff and porters really friendly and helpful. We also visited the bar downstairs and had a cocktail before heading out for dinner, again the staff were really friendly and served up a great cocktail. After returning from dinner we visited Hemmesphere, the cocktail bar at the top of the hotel, again we encountered friendly staff and great cocktails. The only problem we had during our stay was that we spent so long in the shower we flooded the bathroom slightly which in turn went into the bedroom, not a massive flood but we informed front desk about it when we left who were very apologetic and said they would have it checked out. I would highly recommend this hotel. It may not have the amazing views that other Sydney hotels have, in fact it doesn't really have any views, but everything else is so perfect and for A$280 per night, it's well worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “A semi-satisfactory business hotel at the very best”
Reviews.Author: peregrination1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Establishment for our wedding night and the evening after and were bitterly disappointed. They were informed numerous times that it was our wedding night and they didn't even bother to turn the air-conditioning on, much less do anything special. The water pressure in the bath was so bad that we didn't bother waiting for it to fill and just went to bed. Est. restaurant, pretty much the only reason we were staying here was closed on a Sunday evening, something we were not informed of until after we booked, and the room service menu was very, very poor with a choice of very few bland, American friendly meals. I'd say this was a satisfactory business hotel, although when I travel for business all I ask for is a bath, a movie (there are no movies on demand, just bad blockbusters from the 90's you can request from reception) and a decent room service meal, none of which The Establishment provides. This hotel is boutique only in that it lacks services, and like most Merivale establishments is all about the predictable east-meets-west decor and style over substance. Boring.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: My partner and I took a trip around the world and made Australia our first stop. We considered many hotels in Sydney before selecting The Establishment. Boy did we make the right decision. We knew we would be arriving in Sydney from America around 9AM in the morning. Therefore we booked our hotel room for the night before to ensure we would NOT have to wait for a 3PM check-in. We were initially told there was no record of us requesting a room for the previous night at which point I was prepared to make a lot of noise. Lucikly for them a room was available and simply had to be cleaned. We went to the restaurant to have breakfast as they prepared the room. This was the only snafu during our stay. Beyond this.....everything was sensational. Our room was simply stunning. We both love the "modern" style and were not disappointed with The Establishment. The room had a very soothing color palate and a very large bathroom. An extra bonus were the Bose speakers and receiver which allowed us to plug in our iPod and have our room filled with music. The restaurants associated with The Establishment are some of the best in the city. We enjoyed breakfast each morning and on our last night dined at their exquisite sushi restaurant. The concierge treated us as if we were the only guests in the hotel. They were so, so helpful with arranging tour guides and providing assistance with everything we needed. If you want a great hotel, great location, great concierge and great restaurants.....then The Establishment is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but discreeet location!”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshirelittleL
Reviews.Content: We've been to Sydney before and decided that for our second trip we didn't need to go for the harbour views, but wanted more of a boutique hotel. The Establishment didn't disappoint. It is a tad tricky to find, as the taxi driver dropped us at the George Street bar entrance, but we soon found the hotel reception and to be honest it was great to see the bar area - something else! We arrived really early so couldn't check in until late morning, but the receptionist went out of her way to find us a room as soon as she could, so we could crash after our long trip from the UK. The room was excellent, with an open plan bathroom and bedroom and we weren't aware of noise at all. During our stay (4 nights) we loved every minuite of it, the staff were more than helpful but also very discreet and you wouldn't need to see anyone if you didn't want. On the first night we had room service and tucked into a rather tasty burger...so can recommend that! We also had booked with Mr and Mrs Smith, so we received a bottle of 'champagne' on arrival....as I'm sure you'll know if you've been to Oz, quite often 'champagne' is actually a local fizzy, dry wine, which is equally lovely! I had my birthday while we were there, so after a fabulous dinner at Aria down on Circular Quay, we toured all of the various bars including the nightclub, which you can have free access to as a guest of the hotel. It was an amazing club, but with both of us being in our thirties I have to say we felt a bit old! The other bars were much more like it with 'Hemisphere' being the best. It was then excellent just to stagger back to our room. The location of the hotel is spot on...right around the corner from George Street, so a few minutes one way and you're at Circular Quay, Opera House et al and if you go the other way you're right in the heart of all the shops etc. So, all in all and fabulous place to stay in Sydney!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK...thin walls!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelafficianado
Reviews.Content: Somewhat difficult to locate. Boutique and funky edge appears to be loosing its luster. Front desk staff double as porters and concierge and appear quite thin on the ground. Also the desk staff did not seem very well informed about restaurants etc. A request for a rollaway bed had to be made multiple times. The air conditioning was less than adequate for the muggy Sydney weather. The rooms are otherwise ok but if you want to use a hairdryer and a mirror at the same time this may prove challenging. We ate at the restaurant Est, just ok and did not live up to the hype. the bars were crowded and very loud on a Friday evening. We slept poorly as there was a very active couple in the next room, which honestly at times felt they were in the same room. Also the street noise was annoying. I understand the carpeted rooms may be quieter. All in all, I would not stay again and would probably go with the Westin or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique/warehouse style in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bel80
Reviews.Content: Having been to Sydney more than a few times, and frequenting Establishment bar and Hemmesphere, we decided to stay at the hotel for once, and we were very surprised! The room had sort of a Japanese/boutique/warehouse feel to it. You enter the room, and the bedroom was very long, with lots of storage space and big desk. Slide open the doors at the end of the room and you enter the bathroom, with a walk-in shower and separate bathtub in the centre. Toiletries were from Bulgari - we loved the soap. Although hard to find the main front door (we arrived through the bar) the location is great - a brief 10 minute walk gets you to Circular Quay for all the ferries. A further 5 minutes from there you're at the Opera House. in the other direction, 10 minutes gets you to the famous Queen Victoria arcade (and my favourite The Strand Arcade - for designers such as Bettina Liano, Alannah Hill, Lisa Ho, Zimmerman, Farage, etc). And because you're on George Street, there are plenty of buses to various places like Bondi and Oxford Street. The Japanese sushi restaurant at Hemmesphere is a must! But be sure to book! Unfortunately we didn't get to try Est. but we have heard many people give great reviews. Hemmesphere is my favourite place to lounge and relax. They even sell their own compilation CD (up to series 5 now). A block away from the Queen Vic building is Bacasse. Do try their lovely modern tasting menu!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: NBJP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights as part of our honeymoon in Sydney. The rooms were fantastic, very spacious, lovely interior design and great bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The small touches such as fresh cookies each evening and champagne on arrival made our stay even more special. The location of the hotel is ideal for exploring Sydney about 5mins from Circular Quay, and within walking distance of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Botanic Gardens, The Rocks & Darling Harbour. There was however one major downside to our stay - the pretentious staff in Hemisphere (the bar upstairs). They were very rude and the level of service was non existent. This put us off from trying any of the other bars / restaurants owned by 'Establishment'. This however is no reflection on the hotel which we would happily return to.

Reviews.Title: “Private & Trendy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susiek61
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at The Establishment; it is incredibly convenient if you're doing some touristy things, but it's the vibe of the exclusive low-key lobby, the "down an alley" entrance and pub, and the ultra-hip restaurants and bars that make this place unique. This is not a view hotel; but the rooms and baths are incredible. There are two color schemes to choose - dark and light. I went with light and it was the right choice for a summer vacation feel. And nothing can beat these bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience... Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: ATLWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Sydney. The Establishment suites and even more so its staff made it into a memorable one. Our suite was spacious and beautifully appointed with a bold modern look. The hotel offers 4 restaurants, a bar and one of sydney's trendiest night clubs all in the same facility. We thoroughly enjoyed the mojitos at the bar, breakfast and lunch at the main restaurant, sushi dinner at the Japanese restaurant. We appreciated less the thumping noise from the night club over the weekend. But above and beyond all that, the staff made us feel so welcome and at home with friendly and useful advice and ideas on where to go and what to do. They also arranged an excellent guided tour for us to the Blue Mountains. This hotel is certainly a place we would love to go back to!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: daslondon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the best part of a week when i was in Sydney for a wedding. Staff were exceptionally friendly and service was first class. Room fit out is great with large bed and Bose stereo though CRT rather than LCD tvs let it down and there are no views other than into office buildngs. With the harbour on your doorstep who cares? Huge bathrooms with large bath, tropical rainshower and double sinks. Hotel gym small and not massively equiped but enough for a simple workout. The hotel bars are great and get busy at weekends. All in all a great hotel and one that set the expected standard for me for boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozbox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a while ago so I can't remember lots of detail. I do recall upon first being driven through the tall modern office blocks of Sydney at about 6am and thinking "Oh my god, what sort of place will this be". It really is hidden in the middle of the CBD and being an old fashion house factory, I believe, it isn't half as tall as the surrounding buildings. So, if you are looking for stunning views of Sydney this is not the hotel for you. If, however, you want something individual and within walking distance to darling harbour, the bridge and opera house then this will do! We (two adults) were booked to stay for two nights as a rest before we had to fly onto Brisbane. I wish we had stayed longer. We thought we may have to wait for our room as we had arrived so early but no, they had even upgraded us to a junior suite. The room was beautiful. Furnished in an oriental style - very modern and luxurious. A huge comfortable bed, chaise lounge, Bose stereo system and a large bath with marble surround. The rainfall effect shower was fantastic, just what you need after a 23 hour flight! We tried to eat in the restaurant, but it was fully booked as it is very popular and also can be a haunt for celebs visiting Sydney so, we can't comment on the food there. We did manage to order breakfast in our room which was lovely, although a little pricey. I can't complain, however, as we were given such a fantastic rate on the room. We booked online through the hotel itself and at the time they had lots of discounts for April. I believe some previous reviews had commented about the noise from the basement nightclub but we never heard anything. I think we were on the fourth floor though. We will definitely stay here again - when the kids have left home!

Reviews.Title: “Great room interiors”
Reviews.Author: squirrelone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night recently. Normally stay at the Westin but thought we woulod give this a try. The room interiors are amazing being an old building been refurbished. The bathrooms are better than most hotels I have stayed in and the room we were in was quite large with a nice sitting room and bed. The bed was a queen and did seem to be a bit old as we kept rolling into the middle during the night. We ordered room service and it came very quickly and was very good. Breakfast in the Garden lounge was also very nice (though I asked for boiled eggs and was advised they didn't offer that even though the menu said eggs any style), however the pancakes were good. The bar downstairs was heaving with workers on a Friday night and was not really a relaxing place if you just wanted a drink. We left after one cause I felt like it was work for me but if that is your scene then the bars at this hotel are great. The one downside is the noise. We were over the bar and though no noise from it people leaving did make a lot of noise and woke me up (and I had jetlag and am a heavy sleeper). Also early in the morning the garbage trucks seemed to have endless bins emptying with glass bottles. This is a different hotel than a big chain so I did not expect complete silence but if you do then don't stay here. I would probably go back cause I like the architecture of the building and would like to see more of it. However I would not recommend it if you are wanting a big hotel chain experience.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our round the world Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Kuu_travel
Reviews.Content: We are just back from our honeymoon and I wanted to review this hotel as it has been one of the highlights of the whole trip only competing with our weeding night hotel in Helsinki (check hotel Glo if you go there). I found the hotel because I read some good reviews in travel forums and even it sounded great on paper I was a bit nervous as Sydney was a special place for us in this trip and I wanted the hotel to be up to it, but as I did not know the group I was not sure it was going to be so good. Fortunately not only we were not dissapointed but found it nicer than expected and my husband congratulated me because it was really a nice surprise to him. The hotel is really modern, chic and nice and full of special touches. The entrance in a back street is a bit strange and at the beginning we were a bit surprised and a bit worried but on the plus side it adds to the feeling of discovery and place reserved to a few and if you do not like to go in from there you can always get in and out through the bar entrance and stop for a drink in your way! The lobby is nice but also a bit strange as it gives you more the feeling of being in a club lounge. The staff was really friendly and check in and out was very smooth. We only had a small problem as we booked a parking space and when we arrived with the car the places were full but they finally found and extra place. The room was big with a very nice modern and minimalistic decor, a comfy bed, great stereo, a domotic system through the phone to control temperature, do not disturb sign, the lights... very nice to change the mood of the room from the bed. As a night snack instead of the classic chocolates they left two gigant chocolate cookies every night that were truly fantastic. The bathroom was also great (especially the huge walk in shower -there is also a big bath tub if you prefere- and the Bulgary amenities) and could be comunicated with the room if wanted. The only minus point was the lack of a view as it faced the back stree and the surronding backs of office buildings a pity in such a nice city but the location of the hotel was very central and handy. Breakfast was included in the room rate but it only included Continental, not the cooked menu options even the price was almost the same. That was a bit of a problem as we where staying 4 nights and the continental selection is of a very good quality (freshly squeezed juice, greek style yoghourt, fresh fruit salad...) but very limited (only bread with butter-marmalede, cereals, fruit salad and pastries but not salty options). When we asket the front desk they say we should negociate it with the breakfast manager and we could finally change at least for a day to have some nice fresh pancakes, but it was a bit annoying. Another plus of the hotel is the set ot restaurants and night clubs attached. Normally we are too tired after a long day out to go out at night but here you have a nice trendy bar just downstairs so it is great four a drink before going to sleep. We where twice in the main bar to check the salsa, and back to school nights, both very animated and fun and we spend a third one in the upstairs lounge that was nice with relaxing music but the atmosphere was a bit strange with to many men waiting for women to arrive and keep then company. If I go back to Sydney I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Establishment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestofly76
Reviews.Content: We booked through Mr & Mrs Smith, who weâ€™ve used with great success in the past for European hotels from their guidebooks, so we were pleasantly surprised to discover on their website that they now feature hotels as far a field as Australia! We were made to feel special from the beginning of our trip, during our stay and right to the very end of our departure from the beautiful Establishment in Sydney. We received the Smith membership benefit of a bottle of champagne, VIP treatment in the hotelâ€™s nightclub and on request the added benefit of a late departure from our room so we didnâ€™t have to rush when we were packing for our long journey home. The hotel is wonderfully modern and beautifully designed. The staff were so helpful and the city of Sydney and its inhabitants are so hospitable. Such a great getaway down under.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosieFlynn
Reviews.Content: I've just left the Establishment, having stayed there for 11 nights for business. I found the hotel great and by the end of my stay was really sad to leave! This is a small hotel that is part of a sort of complex (I use this word loosely), of bars, restaurants, night club - all of which you can indulge in or not - your decision and the hotel is kept seperate from the facilities. Room: I stayed in room 54 and it was great, plenty of space, good facilities, great bed and internet access was free of charge.Turn down service was very thorough and the cookies each evening are dangerous for the waist line! Towels and linen were devine, one thing I dislike is hotels that use bad versions of these, and it certainly didn't feel like the case here. Without a doubt one of the best rooms I've stayed in while on a business trip. Location: This was my first time in Sydney, so I was unsure of the distances between the tourist attractions and also the different neighbourhoods. So it was a pleasent surprise to find that the hotel was in the perfect spot, just a few minutes walk to Circular Quay, Harbor Bridge, Opera House and add 10/15/20 minutes onto this for Darling Harbor, Oxford St, Darlinghurst. Hotel Facitilties: As I mentioned the hotel has a number of bar's and restaurants that, as a guest you will have access to. I didn't venture in to any of these, mainly because there was much to see outside of the hotel! I did access my room via the Establishment Bar a few times, and although is a beautiful bar to look at with amazing architecture, the whole place felt like a bit of a meat market and just not the kind of bar I woudl hang out in...but if that's you thing then it woudl be perfect! There was also a small work out room which you could access at any time with the your room key. I went a number of times and was always the only person there, they have free weights, treadmill, bike, crosstrainer, swiss balls and soem other bit and peices. If there are any keen runners I was reccomend the route from Circular Quay, past the Opera House followign the water around to the botanical gardens and then cut through there to get back on to Bridge street - such a wonderful route with amazing veiws! Staff: I found everbody I encounted really friendly and helpful and I'll stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “not great....”
Reviews.Author: weemebelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my lovely new husband for 5 nights of our honeymoon. The hotel is in a very handy location however wedged between 2 taller buildings it did get a bit claustrophobic in the room at times with little natural light. The room was fab -very modern. I loved the bath in the middle of the room joining bedroom & bathroom (but i slipped one night when washing my feet in it & nearly broke my arm!) We had heard reports about noise however we were very lucky to get a room on the 5th floor at the opposite end to the gym/bar etc. Unfortunately customer service was greatly lacking and due to this I would not recommend this hotel. Staff were not at all friendly, nor helpful. We had problems when trying to book a taxi one night and also when asking where to eat. The hotel also has a lot of wannabees hanging around it creating quite a pretentious atmosphere. We found the whole stay very impersonal and were very glad to be moving on....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JWEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the black and white rooms - dark wood floors, exposed beams and white walls, for 3 nights in March. One of the best looking rooms we have stayed in for a long time (so much so that my girlfriend had to video the room as soon as we got in it because she loved it so much!) Staff were very friendly and helpful at check-in but almost non existent at breakfast - we went down one morning, helped ourself to the continental offering and no one came to take our order for tea/coffee and hot breakfast - no one in 25 minutes of waiting! The hotel rooms are an add-on to a very trendy bar complex with a huge main bar, a smaller cocktail bar upstairs, two restaurants and a small bar next to hotel check-in (and a nightclub we never tried). All the venues are amazing and full of Sydney's beautiful people, however this leads to a lot of noise outside in the early hours - think they should invest in a bit of sound proofing - both the windows and doors are inadequate for the job so don't stay here unless you want to hear the action as well. Great place to be if you want to feel like one of the cool people but don't come expecting a quite, relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Osmosis5
Reviews.Content: Wow...this is what hotel experiences should be like! We stayed here for a week whilst we were in Sydney for our wedding. It truly was a great experience and there is not one thing that I can fault. You know you are in a great establishment (excuse the terrible pun) when nothing is too much trouble. The staff were brilliant - so accommodating and everything done with a smile. Whether it was finding a parking space for the car or organising a breakfast for 15 including non hotel guests. The rooms were perfect and of a very good size with enough gadgetry to satisfy the inner geek in all of us! I believe we had one of the best rooms as We had other friends staying at the hotel and our room (31) seemed to be that little bit bigger. I would definitely recommend the dark rooms over the light rooms for that extra edge of style. Some other reviews have complained of noise but I can honestly say that on the 3rd floor we had no problems with it...also i guess on Friday and Saturday nights we were probably joining in with the revellry. The bars are pretty decent but are probably victims of their own successs come the weekend as they are packed. Much nicer to be able to enjoy them during the week. All in all I can't recommend this place highly enough...we'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: relucanttraveler
Reviews.Content: i'm definitely more likely to book a stay with a boutique hotel vs a major chain. i found the establishment hotel one of the better boutiques i've stayed in. i stayed for 2 nights (thursday and friday) by myself (woman in my early 30s) and then moved to another hotel, blue, for 2 other nights, only because i extended my trip and when i did so, the establishment hotel was already overbooked. here are the pros/cons of the hotel, from my experience: pros: 1. location. the location, which i was somewhat skeptical about, was actually quite convenient and very short and safe walking distance to all the tourist haunts (opera house, harbour bridge, circular quay, shopping, chinatown, botanical gardens) in sydney. 2. rooms. the rooms were surprisingly and pleasantly large, with very nice layout. i stayed on the 3rd floor. the room was large with beautiful wide, dark wood flooring. the bed (i'm assuming it was a queen) was on a platform against one wall. a living area and desk area were also part of the spacious room. the hallway leading to the bathroom was all closets. the bathroom was interesting. split tub and shower, double sinks, and toilet separate as well. the tub had a partition that would either join the bathroom to the rest of the space/living area/bedroom or could be closed to make the bathroom truly a separate space. since i was traveling alone, i left that partition open the entire time, which made the room seem even larger. the phone next to the bed had all sorts of controls on them to change the lighting set-up, room temperature, direct dial to hot sydney restaurants, and all the other good stuff. 3. value. the establishment is a bit pricey for most people, granted. but if you're able and willing to spend around $320 AUS for a room, then this is your place. this included a decently sized room -- maybe twice or more the size of a room in any of the nyc boutique hotels like the hudson, chambers, etc. that also included breakfast, which i only discovered the day i left unfortunately, from anything, it seemed, from their breakfast menu, plus free wired high speed internet in the rooms. they also had a small exercise room with towels and water too. comparing that to the $290 AUS i paid to stay at blue hotel (with $25 AUS for internet access for a 24 hour period and no breakfast), i found the establishment to be a better overall deal and value. 4. food. i thought the food options in the hotel were fab. i didn't get to try sushi e, but did lunch in the bar a few times and got room service, which i found to be good, worth the money, and most importantly, diverse in offering. 5. service. good service, attentive, helpful, etc. they found the random things that i had requested, and were very timely with any requests. professional, helpful, and not at all pretentious. cons: 1. noise. i read about the noise complaints on this site prior to booking my stay. strangely i didn't hear any of the nightclub noise. what i could hear, though, loudly, was the noise from the hallway. the first night i stayed there, some other people were entertaining others in their room, and i could hear people, word for word, when they spoke in the hallway. same goes, unfortunately, for the noise coming from the room next to mine. i could literally hear my next-door neighbour dial his phone, talk to someone on speakerphone, and could hear and understand every single word said. it was kind of creepy, and i'm fortunate that i discovered this only the morning i was leaving. other noise was street noise -- there was some construction going on near the hotel, and that started early each morning. 2. ambiance. i was double-minded about whether to count this as a pro or a con. the establishment bar downstairs facing george street is a very popular place. because i kept forgetting how to get to the hotel entrance, i constantly walked through the bar to get to the elevator that would take me to my room. on the first night, i literally had to wedge myself between people to get through the room. it was that packed. which is fine, but wasn't the best place for a woman, traveling alone, to be able to have a leisurely drink without getting harrassed. the crowd is definitely mixed. friday night i ventured downstairs for a few cocktails and was simultaneously pawed and ignored at the same time. lots of men in suits, straight from the office, but also an eclectic crowd of international-looking peeps as well. hard to put my finger on it. people were dressed up to go out, which was nice in some ways but also hilarious. the things that people wear! i wasn't used to how dressed up people were coming from san francisco, where it's more hipsters in a lot of places vs the low cut, tight, short, party time clothes that most of the women wore. still, not saying this was a complete con, as i felt the rest of the hotel made up for any annoyance this caused. and i guess i was amused by this, which could make it into a pro as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Establishment Hotel is worth finding”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and very hard to find but well worth the effort. The service is extraordinary and the staff can't do enough to help you. The personal attention is supurb.The lobby and rooms are elegantly understated. The beds are sensational with luxuriously soft linens. The shower and bath area are a dream come true. Most of all we loved the location. Although the entrance is in an alley, the hotel is within walking distance to The Rocks district. We arrived after a 14 hour flight and dropped off our luggage and went for a walk. There was so much to do within a few minutes of the hotel. Breakfast was included and the meal was scrumptous. Lots of healthy choices and a unique atmosphere thats stark and chic at the same time. One word of caution, the restaurant was very expensive and a disappointment. There are so many good choices nearby as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique (even with Baby)”
Reviews.Author: Megandavid
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Sydney many times and know how important location which is why we choose the Establishment this time around. In addition, we also planned to dine at the Est. restaurant, arguably the best in Sydney and we'd also been impressed by the hotel bar during a previous weekend in Sydney. This time around we were travelling with our 15 month old baby boy and we were a little worried, as in our experience boutique hotels are reluctant to cater for small children (if at all... cots ruin the aesthetic?). This was definitely not the case at Establishment and the staff were exceptional in their personal care for us during our stay (it didn't seem forced like at most hotels). This level of service was consistent throughout all aspects of the hotel. An example of this, was a (hilarious rockstar-like) escort by a helpful security guard through the very busy bar (the longest in Southern Hemisphere) packed with beautiful Sydney-siders to get the lift to the restaurant. Again, once at the Est. restaurant, we were exceptionall treated as well and weren't made to feel like aliens for having our little boy beside us asleep in his buggy despite the calibre of the restaurant/clientele. As for the room; the little extras and the styling were perfect, the stunning sound system and free internet a very welcome addition. We also had the most thorough turn down service we have ever seen, complete with delicious homemade cookies. There were a couple of very minor glitches, the bed seemed a little worse for wear (we woke to find ourselves sinking a little in the middle) and there was some noise from other hotel guests (but this is something we felt was beyond the control of hotel staff). That said, we would still thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Sydney looking for something different with an ounce of cool or lust for life. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “superb place”
Reviews.Author: UKBubbles
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year here with our daughter & son in law. Absolutely first class accomodation, efficient & friendly staff, nothing was to much trouble for them. .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Eh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Establishment from Christmas Eve for 4 nights with my wife. This boutique hotel is fantastic. There is a definite "cool" vibe and the staff are very friendly and helpful (not snobby at all). If you are looking for a quieter room, simply ask to stay away from the club or go during the week. I would definitely recommend this hotel and rank it up there with other great boutique hotels that I've stayed at such as the Soho Grand in New York, and Opus in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked, cool & funky”
Reviews.Author: Hotelierhimself
Reviews.Content: Wicked, Just returned from a 10 night stay at the Establishment in Sydney. Fistly and most importantly the rooms are fantastic. Really spacious with a lovely bathroom (bvlgari toiletries) very nice. Seperate walk in shower and bath tub that you can see the tv from. Nice bed and good aircon. Now the food, the breakfast is really great and i really liked the room it was served in. The pastries are awesome and the mushrooms are really tasty. I'm a bit of a foody so usually hard to impress. The food in the room is quite a simple menu, but nobody minds that when its done well. The lamb salad is fantastic and chicken burger great but ask them to go easy on the mayo if watching your weight. The bars in the hotel are known as the best in sydney apparently and don't let you down and as a hotel guest you can use the swanky private bar hemisphere. Which in my opinion is more relaxing than the main bar, which can get over crowded. Service, it annoys me that us english cannot do service like the ozzies as they are professional and really friendly. In all honesty we didn't have any probs and Dion the manager was extremely chatty along with his staff. Advice: the hotel is full quite often by the sounds of things so don't expect a room to early in the morning when you arrive. If you are coming off an early flight from the u.k you should book the room from the night before. Make sure you get your room turned down @ night as they give you some really nice cookies every time. Go too the restaurant Garfish in manly, wicked value for money and seriously good fresh fish. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great room, bad service, and so much noise..”
Reviews.Author: Pepper-Repper
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the monring after a very long flight, and we loved the room. It was lovely, spacious and great design. However once we went to bed, there was so much noise, it felt like our bed was standing in the middle of a very busy bar. Also the neighbours kept slemming the doors and were very noisy, I think this lasted until 2 in the morning. Breakfast that morning is served in the bar area which still smells like alcohol, not the best smell when you are just waking up. The next night we experienced again very loud music and bar noise. We than ordered a wake up call, which woke us up half an hour late and than we ordered a taxi, which arrived, but they did not know which room it was for, so they did not ring us, but send the taxi away.... Not a hotel we would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, indeed.”
Reviews.Author: cl4rk3
Reviews.Content: The Establishment is a perfect hotel. Though there are no spa's, pool's, etc.. the design and creativity is five star, and the architecture is amazing. With two kinds of rooms and two kinds of penthouses, you're sure to have a perfect stay here. This is a top-notch security hotel, where you'll need your key for the hotel entrance, to operate the elevator, to enter your room, and even to enter the restaurants, bars, etc. This place can be both relaxing and exciting, with the (official) best restaurant in Sydney, and accommodation facilities that have landed them in the 'Top 25 Hotels In The World' list. Smoking is allowed in certain rooms, as are pets. It's the perfect getaway, hideout, or whatever you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, boutique hotel..great stay”
Reviews.Author: Loop118
Reviews.Content: Very chic, boutique hotel. Exactly the thing if you are after something different from the Marriots of the world - which are fine but tend to look the same everywhere you go. The rooms are modern, minimailst but comfortable. Loved the bathroom which had a folding blind separating the bath from the bedroom. This was great as after a long day pounding the sydney streets I could sit in the bath and watch a DVD. Bars and restaurants were very cool, especially sushi e. We did not stay at the weekend so cannot comment on the noise levels. Location is ideal for CBD, the Rocks, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Everywhere else easily accessible. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something boutique with great service. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler999
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great location with a cool vibe, big luxury rooms and an overall great experience, then Establishment is for you. The truly amazing thing about the place is that there is so much to offer within the hotel "complex" in terms of a huge and sleek bar, great sushi restaurant upstairs, even better lounge, that you have to pull yourself away to visit other places in Sydney. Since this is such a popular destination for the well-heeled locals to visit well into the night, ask for a room away from the activity. We didn't experience any noise issues since we got a room on the 5th floor on the other side of the downstairs bar. Don't expect views from the bedrooms, but with everything else this hotel offers, you won't miss it (such as the rain shower that appears from the top of the shower ceiling roof). Book this hotel...you'll be happy if you're between 20-45 and looking for a chic spot to rest your feet at the end of the day, and then get back up to experience the scene that it attracts.

HotelInfo.Name: Establishment Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5 Bridge Lane, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
